facts.code:
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Load the dataset
df = pd.read_csv('outputs/simple_iteration/thread_20250815_033304/dataset_selected.csv')

# Filter papers related to sensemaking
df_sensemaking = df[df['AuthorKeywords'].str.contains('sensemaking', case=False, na=False)]

# Group by year and count the number of publications
yearly_trends = df_sensemaking.groupby('Year').size()

# Plot the trends
plt.figure(figsize=(10, 6))
yearly_trends.plot(kind='bar', color='skyblue')
plt.title('Trends in Number of Publications Related to Sensemaking')
plt.xlabel('Year')
plt.ylabel('Number of Publications')
plt.xticks(rotation=45)
plt.tight_layout()
plt.show()

# Print the facts
print("### Begin of facts")
print("Trends in the number of publications related to sensemaking over the years:")
print(yearly_trends)
print("### End of facts")

# Load the dataset

facts.code:
import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import seaborn as sns

# Load the dataset
df = pd.read_csv('outputs/simple_iteration/thread_20250815_033304/dataset_selected.csv')

# Filter papers related to sensemaking
df_sensemaking = df[df['AuthorKeywords'].str.contains('sensemaking', case=False, na=False)]

# Calculate correlation between citation counts and downloads
correlation = df_sensemaking['CitationCount_CrossRef'].corr(df_sensemaking['Downloads_Xplore'])

# Plot the relationship
plt.figure(figsize=(10, 6))
sns.scatterplot(x='CitationCount_CrossRef', y='Downloads_Xplore', data=df_sensemaking)
plt.title('Correlation between Citation Counts and Downloads for Sensemaking Papers')
plt.xlabel('Citation Count (CrossRef)')
plt.ylabel('Downloads (Xplore)')
plt.grid(True)
plt.show()

# Print the facts
print("### Begin of facts")
print(f"Number of sensemaking papers: {len(df_sensemaking)}")
print(f"Correlation between citation counts and downloads: {correlation:.2f}")
print("### End of facts")

facts.code:
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Load the dataset
df = pd.read_csv('outputs/simple_iteration/thread_20250815_033304/dataset_selected.csv')

# Filter papers related to sensemaking
df_sensemaking = df[df['AuthorKeywords'].str.contains('sensemaking', case=False, na=False)]

# Group by year and count the number of publications
yearly_trends = df_sensemaking.groupby('Year').size()

# Plot the trends
plt.figure(figsize=(10, 6))
yearly_trends.plot(kind='bar', color='skyblue')
plt.title('Trends in Number of Publications Related to Sensemaking')

plt.ylabel('Number of Publications')
plt.xticks(rotation=45)
plt.tight_layout()
plt.show()

# Print the facts
print("### Begin of facts")
print("Trends in the number of publications related to sensemaking over the years:")
print(yearly_trends)
print("### End of facts")

question.question: How do the citation counts of sensemaking papers correlate with the number of downloads from Xplore, and what does this indicate about the impact and reach of these papers?

facts.code:
import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import seaborn as sns

# Load the dataset
df = pd.read_csv('outputs/simple_iteration/thread_20250815_033304/dataset_selected.csv')

# Filter papers related to sensemaking
df_sensemaking = df[df['AuthorKeywords'].str.contains('sensemaking', case=False, na=False)]

# Calculate correlation between citation counts and downloads
correlation = df_sensemaking['CitationCount_CrossRef'].corr(df_sensemaking['Downloads_Xplore'])

# Plot the relationship
plt.figure(figsize=(10, 6))
sns.scatterplot(x='CitationCount_CrossRef', y='Downloads_Xplore', data=df_sensemaking)
plt.title('Correlation between Citation Counts and Downloads for Sensemaking Papers')
plt.xlabel('Citation Count (CrossRef)')
plt.ylabel('Downloads (Xplore)')
plt.grid(True)
plt.show()

# Print the facts
print("### Begin of facts")
print(f"Number of sensemaking papers: {len(df_sensemaking)}")
print(f"Correlation between citation counts and downloads: {correlation:.2f}")
print("### End of facts")

import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Load the dataset
df = pd.read_csv('outputs/simple_iteration/thread_20250815_033304/dataset_selected.csv')

# Filter papers related to sensemaking
df_sensemaking = df[df['AuthorKeywords'].str.contains('sensemaking', case=False, na=False)]

# Group by year and count the number of publications
yearly_trends = df_sensemaking.groupby('Year').size()

# Plot the trends
plt.figure(figsize=(10, 6))
yearly_trends.plot(kind='bar', color='skyblue')
plt.title('Trends in Number of Publications Related to Sensemaking')
plt.xlabel('Year')
plt.ylabel('Number of Publications')
plt.xticks(rotation=45)
plt.tight_layout()
plt.show()

# Print the facts
print("### Begin of facts")
print("Trends in the number of publications related to sensemaking over the years:")
print(yearly_trends)
print("### End of facts")

question.question: How do the citation counts of sensemaking papers correlate with the number of downloads from Xplore, and what does this indicate about the impact and reach of these papers?

facts.code:
import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import seaborn as sns

# Load the dataset
df = pd.read_csv('outputs/simple_iteration/thread_20250815_033304/dataset_selected.csv')

# Filter papers related to sensemaking
df_sensemaking = df[df['AuthorKeywords'].str.contains('sensemaking', case=False, na=False)]

# Calculate correlation between citation counts and downloads
correlation = df_sensemaking['CitationCount_CrossRef'].corr(df_sensemaking['Downloads_Xplore'])

# Plot the relationship
plt.figure(figsize=(10, 6))
sns.scatterplot(x='CitationCount_CrossRef', y='Downloads_Xplore', data=df_sensemaking)
plt.title('Correlation between Citation Counts and Downloads for Sensemaking Papers')
plt.xlabel('Citation Count (CrossRef)')
plt.ylabel('Downloads (Xplore)')
plt.grid(True)
plt.show()

# Print the facts
print("### Begin of facts")
print(f"Number of sensemaking papers: {len(df_sensemaking)}")
print(f"Correlation between citation counts and downloads: {correlation:.2f}")
print("### End of facts")
